@EU_Commission @dsracoon @internetthought 2. Does the commission agree with a priori censorship? That means, that the censorship takes place before the content has been uploaded, published, or said?

@EU_Commission @dsracoon @internetthought Also, I would like to get more clarification:
1. Does the Commission agree with that private companies should be able to punish you without going through an impartial court? Censorship is a form of punishment and shouldn't be used lightly.

@EU_Commission @dsracoon @internetthought Cc. @LionelBently

@EU_Commission @dsracoon @internetthought Just because CJEU says what parody is doesn't mean that there is a harmonized parody exception in the EU. That is up to member states to put into theirnelgal corpus. Besides  memes will not in many cases be considered as parody. Some memes may be, but not all.

@EU_Commission @dsracoon @internetthought That is an optional exception  not a mandatory one. To make a harmonized for exceotion for parody was rejected by the Commission and not included in the draft proposal. There are many EU countries that have no parody exception. Because it is _optional_.

@dsracoon @asta_fish @internetthought The CJEU ruled in September 2014 on the interpretation of this Directive, saying that ‘parody’ is an autonomous concept of EU law. This provides certain harmonisation in the EU even if the directive leaves the exception optional for the Member States. (4/4)

@dsracoon @asta_fish @internetthought Many Member States have parody exception in place. Even if in some Member States it is not an explicit exception under the copyright law, parodies are recognised or allowed under different legal acts. (3/4)

@dsracoon @asta_fish @internetthought As with any EU Directive, it is a legislative act that sets out a goal that all EU countries must achieve. However, it is up to the individual countries to devise their own laws on how to reach these goals. (2/4)
@EU_Commission @GOettingerEU #thecorrupteucommission unelected bureaucratic dictatorship. Heil Juncker, Europe's modern Nazi's.
